## GitDocumentDB.mkdir() method

> This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.
> 

Create a collection or open an existing one.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
mkdir(dirpath: string, commitMessage?: string): Promise<PutResult>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  dirpath | string | A name of collection which is represented by the path from localDir. Subdirectories are also permitted. e.g. 'pages', 'pages/works'. collectionName can begin and end with slash, and both can be omitted. e.g. '/pages/', '/pages', 'pages/' and 'pages' show the same collection. |
|  commitMessage | string | Default is <code>mkdir: ${dirpath}</code> |

<b>Returns:</b>

Promise&lt;[PutResult](./git-documentdb.putresult.md)<!-- -->&gt;

## Remarks

This is an alias of mkdir()
